sentence.Network_en: And Julie married Alec, dressed appropriately in virginal white.
sentence.Network_cn: 朱莉穿着一件与此场合相称的纯白婚纱嫁给了亚历克。

sentence.Network_en: Dress appropriately and ask intelligent questions.
sentence.Network_cn: 穿着要得体，提问要机敏。

sentence.Network_en: It's entitled, appropriately enough, "Art for the Nation".
sentence.Network_cn: 它被恰如其分地取名为“为了国家的艺术”。

entry.def: Something that is appropriate is suitable or acceptable for a particular situation.

example.ex: It is appropriate that Irish names dominate the list...
example.tran: 名单上大部分是爱尔兰名字，这没什么不合适的。

example.ex: Dress neatly and attractively in an outfit appropriate to the job...
example.tran: 着装要整洁美观，适合于这份工作。

entry.def: If someone appropriates something which does not belong to them, they take it, usually without the right to do so.

example.ex: Several other newspapers have appropriated the idea...
example.tran: 另外有几家报社已盗用了这个创意。

example.ex: The land was simply appropriated by the rulers.
example.tran: 土地完全被统治者霸占。

entry.def: If a government or organization appropriates an amount of money for a particular purpose, it reserves it for that purpose.

example.ex: Senator Lugar is skeptical that Congress will appropriate more funding for this purpose.
example.tran: 参议员卢格怀疑国会是否会拨出更多资金用于此目的。

auth_sentence.content: I think a win-win is to appropriately educate youth.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: I think a win-win is to appropriately educate youth.

auth_sentence.content: New technology not only evolves rapidly, but appropriately.
auth_sentence.res_content: New technology not only evolves rapidly, but appropriately.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: New technology not only evolves rapidly, but appropriately.

auth_sentence.content: It has, appropriately, been dubbed immigration-delay disease.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =one's/own,表示"拥有"; 2. 引申为恰当的

stems_affixes.word_buile: ap加强+propri恰当的+ate……的→adj.适当的,恰当的,特有的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 所有的, 私人拥有的
stems_affixes.word_buile: proprietor[n.所有者]+y……的,……人等→adj.所有的, 私人拥有的 n.所有者, 所有权
proprietor[n.所有者]+y……的,……人等→adj.所有的, 私人拥有的 n.所有者, 所有权
propri适当的+ety表名词→n.礼节,适当
ex出+propri拥有+at表动词→不再拥有→没收

Sentence.sentence: He has discovered it – babies don't even know that language exists – and he has found out how it works and learnt to use it appropriately.
